title: COST Model-Based Science Learning Design: Interaction and Technology Integration

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary science foundational knowledge and understanding of experimental methodologies
context.additional_context: Science experiment learning utilizing VR simulations in a smartphone-centric limited technological environment, emphasizing self-directed inquiry skills for students/job seekers

learning_goals: Apply the four perspectives of the COST model (Content-Other-Self-Task Interaction) to scientific problem-solving.
Recreate and analyze real scientific experimental environments virtually using VR-based simulation tools.
Present interpretations and discussion results of scientific data with over 80% accuracy through a collaborative system with peer learners.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
